page.title: 01Alresford - Introduction
page.content: This area has an estuary and a tidal creek and large areas of salt marsh and low lying land. The geology is dominated by glacial sands and gravels which have triggered the development of extractive industry. While some quarries are active and even expanding others have been reclaimed for agriculture and a few have become attractive lakes providing a habitat for water birds. There is much arable land, some woods and several large orchards. The area of orchards has been much reduced over recent decades due to residential development. The connection is retained by the naming of roads after varieties of apple.
